reviews.review_msg: I dont know why I didnt like him!!!
he likes a lot of detail. but overall his teaching style is really good. his examples are really clear and based on real life situations. love this man!
I like the explanations
INCREDIBLE PROF! DEFINITELY RECOMMEND TAKING A COURSE WITH HIM!!!
great at lecturing, prepared, current and cared about the students

One of the best proffessors ive had. Very approachable, kind and down-to-earth. Definitely take a class with him, he makes a load of material understandable and makes very good lecture slides. Final was all multiple choice too!
Such a great prof - definitely one of my favourites at SFU.  Very clear, helpful, and willing to go out of his way to help you understand.  Any class he teaches I'll take for sure!

Dr Ruben is an amazing prof. The material isn't the most interesting but I learned so much from him. He makes his own powerpoint presentation so you can get by by just studying his slides or supplementing from the textbook. He's always available for extra help and loves to get to know his students on a personal level.

Dr. Ruben is one of the best Kinesiology profs I've ever had. He's very approachable, encourages questions, and will spend all the time you need to understand a concept. But you usually get it the first time because he's very clear in his explanations. I recommend taking any course taught by him as he makes the material very straight forward.
One of the nicest and best professors that I've had.His exams are very fair.The lectures are very informative and he's always willing to help and he's very knowledgable.
Amaaaazing Prof! Super funny, even reinacted Jon Lajoie's "Breathing"

Awesome prof! I was dreading taking this class, but he managed to make dry material interesting. I heard a rumor he isn't teaching this class next semester, and I feel sorry for future 205'ers for that.

Gina is hands down one of the best profs out there - likeable, knowledgeable, passionate, and follows up with questions asked in class. She has an open door policy and has very patiently explained concepts to me as well as helped me figure out my future career goals. Her exams are not easy, but if you put the work in, you should do well.
She was a good prof.  Very nice.  Tests were fairly tough, though physiology is probably always tough.
Great at explaining concepts, exams were pretty difficult but nice prof overall
Stay away from her anal marker

She is a really good prof.She realy put her heart into it when teaching.When u dont understand something, she will explain it to u more than once,until u understand.She also holds 2hrs tuorial the day b4 exam,go to that for sure b/c big hint for whats going to be on the exam.The course itself may be hard,but she makes it so much easier!!
great prof. so helpful, she has extra office hrs for quizzes and midterm. Go..she give hints. great lecture note, detail, neat and prepared.

An insanely difficult Professor; don't expect to get away with anything.  If you mess up, she will call you on it and make sure everyone in the class knows about it. She can be your best friend or your absolute worst enemy; sadly, it's usually the latter.  Avoid her at all cost.

Dr. Bawa puts a LOT of effort into the course.  She has tons of notes and amazing resources.  Her exams are very fair and reflect what you've learned in class.  However, she expects an overwhelming amount of effort, time and energy on your part. She's a little intense.... but she knows her stuff!

A very caring prof.  She has many review sessions and office hours before quizzes and midterms.  We need more caring profs around.  I wish she taught the whole course rather than only half the course!
She's pretty good, and she gives out the questions on her quizzes before hand so that you can prepare for it.

Kin205/207 TA... He can really breakdown and buildup concepts and questions so that your not just memorizing facts you really understand what your learning why its important and how it works. Should teach course!

Leigh was amazing. I had him for a TA in 205 and 207 and he helped me so much. he always went out of his way to make time to give students extra help if needed. he made physiology make sense! and I would love to take another class with him

I had Leigh as my Prof for Kin207 and I am delighted that I now have him as a TA for Kin205. He is super interested in the material he teaches and he has a way of describing things so that everyone understands. He is very approachable and he makes time for each of his students. You can tell he loves to teach. I would take any course taught by him.
